location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.194 of 1852, from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter to Malet, enclosing a copy of a letter sent to Major Atkins Hamerton, Her Majesty's Consul and the Honourable Company's Agent in the dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, dated 5 June 1852. Kemball's letter informs Hamerton of intelligence he has received from the British Agent at Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh] (not included in the volume), concerning the enslavement of a woman from Sohar [Suhar], who has been taken to Bandar-e Lengeh.
